New Records: India beat Ireland by eight wickets
Key Match Events: Arshdeep Singh dismissed both openers in his second over
Jasprit Bumrah had Tector caught with a short ball
Hardik Pandya picked off three batters in nine balls
Rohit Sharma retired hurt holding his shoulder
Pre-Game Insights: India's batting coach Vikram Rathour agreed that 'it was a challenging wicket'
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland's coach Heinrich Malan complained that 'when you play a game you want the best surface you can get and unfortunately what we’ve seen over the last couple of games hasn’t lived up to that'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match included all of 193 runs, the top score so far in the tournament
The ball reared and kicked and jagged and spat and seamed and stopped; one would shoot through shin high, the next would soar over the batter’s head
Others: The Federal Trade Commission is going to bring an advertising standards case against the International Cricket Council if the cricket carries on like this
